docs.summary: The [React component](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-the-wix-editor-react-component) element allows you to add your own [React](https://react.dev/) component.
description: > This feature is currently only available in [Wix Studio](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-coding-with-wix-studio).
Wix's React Component allows you to add your own [React](https://react.dev/) component to your site, expanding the range of components that are available in the Wix editor.
You can either import an existing component in the React ecosystem to the Wix editor and use it in your code, or write your own React component from scratch.
To learn more about Wix's React component, refer to the following resources:
+ For a general overview of Wix's React component, see [About the Wix editor React Component](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-the-wix-editor-react-component).
+ To set up your React componenet, see [Working with Your React Component](https://support.wix.com/en/article/working-with-your-react-component).
+ For an example and step-by-step tutorial, see [Tutorial: Using a React Component on Your Site](https://support.wix.com/en/article/tutorial-using-a-react-component-on-your-site).

docs.summary: Sets or gets the React component's [props](https://react.dev/learn/passing-props-to-a-component).
description: Use props to pass information from your React component to its child components. Each React component determines which props it supports. You can pass any supported props in the `props` object. The `props` object is a key-value pair.

You can set a prop that defines a callback function that runs when an event is triggered on the React component. For example, an event handler with a [`ReactEvent`](/reactevent). Passing a callback function allows you to handle React events in your code. See the code example, **Pass a function in the React component's props**.
